page.title: 01STORNOWAY SOUTH - GENERAL
page.content: This area has four main features: To the north is the southern part of the town of{Stornoway,}including the inner harbour and the oldest part of the town, the former fishing village of{Newton}and{Goat Island. To the west lies a large area of mixed woodland known as the{Castle Grounds in which is located{Lews Castle. To the South-east lies{Arnish Moor which includes the site of the 19th C. {Lewis Chemical Works,}a monument marking the landing place of{Prince {Charles Edward Stuart}after Culloden, and the{Lewis Offshore complex,}which services oil related equipment for the North Sea rigs. The largest feature in area is {Stornoway Harbour,}a large natural harbour marked at its entrance by Arnish Light.
